titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B116b
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B116b

encodingDesc.p: The original encoding was done in plain text files following the encoding quidelines of the Morgenländische Gesellschaft. With a dedicated web application these plain text files were transformed into XML documents validating (partially) against the Epidoc-Schema and those XML-Documents have been further sematically annotaded.
In order to avoid well known xml-issues especially in regards of overlapping elements the actual edited/annotated text was multiplied in several anonymos blocks, each block providing specific markup.

1.[... ... Yu](harḥib and his brother) 2.[...], the citizens of Hirrān, the leaders of the tribe of Sumʿay, 3.the third of Ḥāshidum, have offered to their patron-deity Taʾlab 4.Riyāmum, Lord of Turʿat, this statue as he had commanded 5.them in his oracle, in order that he might grant them prosperity and well-being 6.and good fortune; and that he might grant them the esteem of the[/their] tribe 7.[... ... ... ... ...]

Yu harḥib and his brother
..., the citizens of Hirrān, the leaders of the tribe of Sumʿay,
the third of Ḥāshidum, have offered to their patron-deity Taʾlab
Riyāmum, Lord of Turʿat, this statue as he had commanded
them in his oracle, in order that he might grant them prosperity and well-being
and good fortune; and that he might grant them the esteem of the/their tribe
...

Yuharḥib and his brother
..., the citizens of Hirrān, the leaders of the tribe of Sumʿay,
the third of Ḥāshidum, have offered to their patron-deity Taʾlab
Riyāmum, Lord of Turʿat, this statue as he had commanded
them in his oracle, in order that he might grant them prosperity and well-being
and good fortune; and that he might grant them the esteem of the/their tribe
